p: Fresh plants (aerial parts) of Trachyspermum khasianum H. Wolff were collected from West Khasi Hills District, Meghalaya, India in September 2018. The herbarium sheet was prepared and authenticated by Dr. N. Devi., Professor and Head, Department of Botany, Guwahati University (Reference No. Herb./GUBH/2018/97 dated on 11/10/2018). After the collection of plants, the fresh plants were washed and dried at room temperature for 2-3 weeks [ 18].
